author: Dion Nissenbaum
title: U.S. Backing for Saudi War in Yemen Draws Congressional Concern
text:
WASHINGTON—The Trump administration’s plan to sell more weapons to Saudi Arabia is running into new resistance in Congress, where lawmakers are raising concerns about the kingdom’s use of U.S.-made missiles that could threaten the deal.
Lawmakers from both parties say the U.S. hasn’t done enough to ensure that the missiles aren’t used by Saudi pilots to kill civilians in Yemen, and some want the administration to impose more conditions on Saudi Arabia’s use of the weapons before they support the proposal, according to people...
